text:
Something new and agonizing

Raskolnikov sits at a table, overwhelmed.  
A strange sensation grips him.  
Raskolnikov: "I can't appeal to them."  

---

The head clerk watches him, curious.  
Head Clerk: "You canâ€™t write, are you ill?"  
Raskolnikov: "Yes, I am giddy. Go on!"  

---

Raskolnikov slumps, head in hands.  
A nail drives into his skull.  
Raskolnikov: "What is happening to me?"

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov experiences an intense and agonizing realization that he can no longer appeal to the police officers with emotional pleas, feeling a profound sense of isolation.
